/curves/forward-curves.x-summary: Generates the Forward curves for the definitions provided.

post.description: Generates the forward curves for the definition provided
post.summary: Generates the forward curves for the definition provided

parameters.description: price a forward zero coupon curve
parameters.name: forwardCurveRequest

200.description: The forward curves have been successfully returned

/curves/zc-curve-definitions.x-summary: Returns the definitions of the available Zero Coupon curves for the filters selected (e.g. currency, index…).

post.description: Returns the definitions of the available Zero Coupon curves for the filters selected (e.g. currency, index…)
post.summary: Returns the definitions of the available Zero Coupon curves for the filters selected (e.g. currency, index…)

parameters.description: search by curve's id or curve's currency, index name, source and valuation date
parameters.name: zcCurveDefinitionRequest

200.description: The definitions have been successfully returned

/curves/zc-curves.x-summary: Generates the Zero Coupon curves for the definitions provided.

post.description: Generates the zero coupon curves for the definitions provided
post.summary: Generates the zero coupon curves for the definitions provided

parameters.description: price a swap zero coupon with or without a collateral currency
parameters.name: zcCurveRequest

200.description: The curves have been successfully returned

/surfaces.x-summary: Generates volatility surfaces for various instuments and asset classes.

post.description:
API endpoint that can be used to generate volatility surfaces for various instuments and asset classes. 
The resulting volatilities are returned as points, slices, or full surface either in a list of in a matrix format.
post.summary:
API endpoint that can be used to generate volatility surfaces for various instuments and asset classes. 
The resulting volatilities are returned as points, slices, or full surface either in a list of in a matrix format.

parameters.description: Contains the parameters of the request: surface types, definitions and parameters, and specifies how to return the surface data in response.
parameters.name: volatilitySurfaceRequest

instrumentType.description: The type of instrument being defined.

surfaceLayout.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is returned

surfaceTag.description: A user defined string to describe the volatility surface

underlyingType.description: The type of the underlying used to generate the volatility surface

meanReversionPercent.description: Reversion speed rate, expressed in percents, used to calculate the convexity adjustment

volatilityPercent.description: Reversion flat volatility, expressed in percents, used to calculate the convexity adjustment

currency.description:
Currency of the credit curve
For the moment is is mandatory to compute default probabilities

referenceEntity.description:
Reference entity from which the credit data must be find. It can be:

    - OrgId of the issuer company

    - Ric of a credit Default Swap

    - Ric of a credit Default Swap Index

    - ChainRic of a credit curve

referenceEntityType.description: Type of reference entity used in field ReferenceEntity

extrapolationMode.description:
Flag to define whether extrapolation is allowed.
Optional.

interpolationMode.description:
Interpolation method for the curve.
Optional.

currency.description:
The currency code of the deposit curve.
Mandatory.

source.description:
The source of the market date : composite, the mnemonic of the contributor. For ontributor a specific entitlement may be required. 
Optional. By default composite data is returned

extrapolationMode.description:
Flag to define whether extrapolation is allowed.
Optional.

interpolationMode.description:
Interpolation method for the curve.
Optional.

source.description:
The source of the market date : composite, the mnemonic of the contributor. For ontributor a specific entitlement may be required. 
Optional. By default composite data is returned

key.description: The key in the path causing the error.

EtiSurfaceDefinition.description: The volatility surface definition for a listed instrument (e.g. equity, indices)

exchange.description: Specifies the exchange to be used to retrieve the underlying data.

instrumentCode.description:
The code (RIC for equities and indices and RICROOT for Futures.) that represents the instrument.
The format for equities and indices is xxx@RIC (Example: VOD.L@RIC)
The format for Futures is xx@RICROOT (Example: CL@RICROOT)

EtiSurfaceParameters.description: The parameters needed to define the volatility surface for a listed instrument (e.g. equity, indices)

calculationDate.description: The date the volatility surface is generated.

inputVolatilityType.description:
Specifies the type of volatility used as an input of the model (calculated Implied Volatility, Settlement)

 - Settle: [DEPRECATED] The service uses the settlement volatility to build the volatility surface

 - Quoted: The service uses the quoted volatility to build the volatility surface

 - Implied: The service internally calculates implied volatilities for the option universe before building the surface

priceSide.description: Specifies whether bid, ask or mid is used to build the surface.

timeStamp.description:
Define how the timestamp is selected:
- Open: the opening value of the valuationDate or if not available the close of the previous day is used.
- Default: the latest snapshot is used when valuationDate is today, the close price when valuationDate is in the past.

volatilityModel.description:
The quantitative model used to generate the volatility surface. This may depend on the asset class.
For Fx Volatility Surface, we currently support the SVI model.

xAxis.description: Specifies the unit for the x axis (e.g. Date, Tenor)

yAxis.description:
Specifies the unit for the y axis (e.g. Strike, Delta). This may depend on the asset class.
For Fx Volatility Surface, we support both Delta and Strike.

instrumentCode.description:
The code (RIC for equities and indices and RICROOT for Futures.) that represents the instrument.
Can be equal to '*' to design every instrument

surfaceLayout.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is returned

surfaceParameters.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is generated

surfaceTag.description: A user defined string to describe the volatility surface

underlyingDefinition.description: The section that contains the properties that define the underlying instrument

underlyingType.description: The type of the underlying used to generate the volatility surface

forwardCurveTenors.description: Defines expected forward rate surface tenor/slices

forwardStartDate.description: Defines the forward start date by date format

forwardStartTenor.description: Defines the forward start date by tenor format: "Spot" / "1M" / ...

referenceCcy.description: Reference currency used as a pivot currency.

source.description:
Source of the market data : composite or the mnemonic of the contributor. For contributor a specific entitlement may be required. 
Optional. By default composite data is returned

extrapolationMode.description:
Flag to define whether extrapolation is allowed.
Optional.

interpolationMode.description:
Interpolation method for the curve.
Optional.

referenceCcy.description: The reference currency used as a pivot currency.

source.description:
The source of the market date : composite, the mnemonic of the contributor. For ontributor a specific entitlement may be required. 
Optional. By default composite data is returned

atmVolatilityObject.description: At the money volatility at Expiry

calculationDate.description: The date the volatility surface is generated.

fxSwapCalculationMethod.description:
The method we chose to price outrights using or not implied deposits. Possible values are:

 FxSwap (compute outrights using swap points),

 DepositCcy1ImpliedFromFxSwap (compute currency1 deposits using swap points),

 DepositCcy2ImpliedFromFxSwap (compute currency2 deposits using swap points).

 Optional. Defaults to 'FxSwap'.

priceSide.description: Specifies whether bid, ask or mid is used to build the surface.

timeStamp.description:
Define how the timestamp is selected:
- Open: the opening value of the valuationDate or if not available the close of the previous day is used.
- Default: the latest snapshot is used when valuationDate is today, the close price when valuationDate is in the past.

volatilityModel.description:
The quantitative model used to generate the volatility surface. This may depend on the asset class.
For Fx Volatility Surface, we currently support the SVI model.

xAxis.description: Specifies the unit for the x axis (e.g. Date, Tenor)

yAxis.description:
Specifies the unit for the y axis (e.g. Strike, Delta). This may depend on the asset class.
For Fx Volatility Surface, we support both Delta and Strike.

fxCrossCode.description:
The ISO code of the cross currency (e.g. 'EURCHF').
Mandatory.

surfaceLayout.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is returned

surfaceParameters.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is generated

surfaceTag.description: A user defined string to describe the volatility surface

underlyingDefinition.description: The section that contains the properties that define the underlying instrument

underlyingType.description: The type of the underlying used to generate the volatility surface

currency.description:
The currency code of the interest rate curve.
Mandatory.

name.description:
The name of the interest rate curve.
Mandatory.

discountingType.description: the discounting type of the IR vol model: OisDiscounting, or BorDiscounting (default)

instrumentCode.description: The currency of the stripped cap surface, vol cube, or interest rate vol model

shiftPercent.description: Shift value to use in calibration(Strike/Forward). Default: 0.0

volatilityAdjustmentType.description: Volatility Adjustment method for stripping: ConstantCaplet, ConstantCap, ShiftedCap, NormalizedCap, NormalizedCaplet

xAxis.description: Specifies the unit for the x axis (e.g. Date, Tenor)

yAxis.description:
Specifies the unit for the y axis (e.g. Strike, Delta). This may depend on the asset class.
For Fx Volatility Surface, we support both Delta and Strike.

zAxis.description: Specifies the unit for the z axis (e.g. Strike, Tenor, Expiries). This applies on Ir SABR Volatility Cube.

chainRic.description:
The chain ric of the interest rate curve.
Mandatory.

currency.description:
The currency code of the interest rate curve.
Mandatory.

name.description:
The name of the interest rate curve.
Mandatory.

dayCountBasis.description: Day count basis used to compute the rates of the curve points

extrapolationMode.description:
Flag to define whether extrapolation is allowed.
Optional.

interpolationMode.description:
Interpolation method for the curve.
Optional.

meanReversionPercent.description: Used for Bermudans and HW1F calibration

date.description: EffectiveDate: effective date of the rate step

ratePercent.description: RatePercent: stepped rate expressed in percent

dataPoints.description: Specifies the list of specific data points to be returned.

format.description: Specifies whether the calculated volatilities are returned as a list or a matrix.

xPointCount.description:
Specifies the number of values that will be generated along the x-axis. 
These values will distributed depending on the available input data and the type of volatility.

xValues.description: Specifies a list of discrete values for the x-axis.

yPointCount.description:
Specifies the number of values that will be generated along the y-axis.
These values will distributed depending on the available input data and the type of volatility.

yValues.description: Specifies a list of discrete values for the y-axis.

zPointCount.description:
Specifies the number of values that will be generated along the z-axis. 
These values will distributed depending on the available input data and the type of volatility.

zValues.description: Specifies a list of discrete values for the z-axis.

id.description: Id of the curve definition to get

indexTenors.description:
Defines expected rate surface tenor/slices
Defaults to the tenors available, based on provided market data

extrapolationMode.description:
None: no extrapolation
Constant: constant extrapolation
Linear: linear extrapolation

interestCalculationMethod.description:
Day count basis of the calculated zero coupon rates.
Default value is: Dcb_Actual_Actual

interpolationMode.description:
Interpolation method used in swap zero curve bootstrap.
Default value is: CubicSpline

CubicDiscount: local cubic interpolation of discount factors
CubicRate: local cubic interpolation of rates
CubicSpline: a natural cubic spline
Linear: linear interpolation
Log: log linear interpolation
ForwardMonotoneConvex

priceSide.description:
Defines which data is used for the rate surface computation.
Default value is: Mid

referenceTenor.description: Root tenor(s) for the xIbor dependencies

steps.description:
Use to calculate the swap rate surface discount curve, when OIS is selected as discount curve.
The steps can specify overnight index stepped dates or/and rates.

turns.description: Used to include end period rates/turns when calculating swap rate surfaces

useConvexityAdjustment.description:
false / true
Default value is: true.
It indicates if the system needs to retrieve the convexity adjustment

useMultiDimensionalSolver.description:
false / true
Default value is: true.
Specifies the use of the multi-dimensional solver for yield curve bootstrapping.
This solving method is required because the bootstrapping method sometimes creates a ZC curve which does not accurately reprice the input instruments used to build it.
The multi-dimensional solver is recommended when cubic interpolation methods are used in building the curve (in other cases, performance might be inferior to the regular bootstrapping method).
 - true: to use multi-dimensional solver for yield curve bootstrapping
 - false: not to use multi-dimensional solver for yield curve bootstrapping

useSteps.description:
false / true
Default value is: false.
It indicates if the system needs to retrieve the overnight index stepped dates or/and rates

valuationDate.description:
The valuation date
Default value is the current date

instrumentType.description: The type of instrument being defined.

surfaceLayout.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is returned

surfaceTag.description: A user defined string to describe the volatility surface

underlyingType.description: The type of the underlying used to generate the volatility surface

x.description: The coordinate of the volatility data point on the x-axis

y.description: The coordinate of the volatility data point on the y-axis

outputs.description:
The Requested ouputs.
Optional. By default only data are returned.

universe.description: The list of Volatility Surface Definitions

surfaceLayout.description: The section that contains the properties that define how the volatility surface is returned

surfaceTag.description: A user defined string to describe the volatility surface

underlyingType.description: The type of the underlying used to generate the volatility surface

volatilitySurfaces.description: The list of volatility surfaces that have been generated based on the request.

error.description:
An object that contains either:

    - the description properties of an error.

    - or Null when no error is returned.

goodnessOfFit.description: The goodness of fit for VolSurface

headers.description: The list of column headers that describe the columns returned in the case of a "List" format

moneynessStrike.description: The strike level associated to the moneyness level for VolSurface

surfaceTag.description: The user-defined tag provided in the request or a generated one if no tag were provided.

id.description: Id of the curve definition to get

curveTag.description:
User defined string to identify the curve. It can be used to link output results to the curve definition.
Only alphabetic, numeric and '- _.#=@' characters are supported.
Optional.

id.description: Id of the curve definition to get
Id of the curve definition to get

Defines expected rate surface tenor/slices
Defaults to the tenors available, based on provided market data

The multi-dimensional solver is recommended when cubic interpolation methods are used in building the curve (in other cases, performance might be inferior to the regular bootstrapping method).
 - true: to use multi-dimensional solver for yield curve bootstrapping
